summary: This is a prosecution memorandum from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York seeking authorization to charge Ghislaine Maxwell with two counts of conspiracy related to the transportation and enticement of a minor for illegal sexual activity. It details Maxwell's role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of a minor victim, referred to as Victim-1, and includes corroborating evidence from flight logs, witness interviews, and other victims. This document is a prosecution memorandum detailing allegations against Ghislaine Maxwell for conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to transport and entice minors for illegal sexual activity. It includes detailed victim testimony describing abuse by Epstein and grooming/complicity by Maxwell, spanning multiple years and locations. The document outlines proposed charges, legal elements, and evidentiary considerations.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as actively grooming and facilitating the sexual abuse of minors by Jeffrey Epstein, including arranging travel, providing instructions, and making explicit comments about Epstein's sexual needs.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure whose sexual abuse of minors, including Victim-1, was facilitated by Ghislaine Maxwell. The charges against Maxwell stem from her assistance in his crimes.

persons.name: David Rodgers
persons.context: Piloted Epstein's private jets from 1991 to 2019, maintained flight logs, and was interviewed. His logs corroborate Victim-1's travel with Epstein and Maxwell.

persons.name: Juan Alessi
persons.context: Worked for Epstein in Palm Beach from 1990 to 2002. He recalls Maxwell taking over household management, picking up Victim-1, and driving her, Maxwell, and Epstein to movies.

persons.name: Eva Anderson (Eva Dubin)
persons.context: Described by Juan Alessi as Epstein's pleasant and friendly girlfriend before he began dating Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Maria Alessi
persons.context: Juan Alessi's wife who worked part-time for Epstein. Interviewed but not believed to have relevant information.

persons.name: Virginia Giuffre
persons.context: Referred to as 'Victim-2' in the document. Provides detailed testimony of sexual abuse by Epstein and grooming/facilitation by Maxwell, including trips to Palm Beach, the Virgin Islands, Paris, and New York.

persons.name: Jane
persons.context: Referred to as 'Victim-1'. Alleged she was sexually assaulted by Epstein and Maxwell as an adult. Has spoken to news outlets.

persons.name: Annie Farmer
persons.context: Referred to as 'Victim-3'. Describes being recruited at age 16, groomed by Maxwell and Epstein in New Mexico, and subjected to inappropriate touching and a massage by Maxwell.

persons.name: Michael Garland
persons.context: Introduced to Virginia Giuffre by Maxwell. Maxwell told Garland she had known Giuffre since she was 17, which Giuffre took as evidence Maxwell knew she was underage when they met.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorneys
persons.context: Authors of the prosecution memorandum, recommending charges against Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Maxwell facilitated Epstein's sexual abuse of minors by grooming victims, arranging travel, and participating in group sexual encounters.
Maxwell groomed Victim-1 for abuse, acted as a 'cool older sister' to normalize the situation, and facilitated her travel to Epstein's properties.
Epstein sexually abused Victim-1 from age 14, giving her money, paying for lessons, and escalating abuse over several years.
Alessi was Epstein's house manager in Palm Beach from 1990 to 2002, taking directions from him and later from Maxwell.
After Maxwell became involved, Alessi was told to take orders from her regarding house operations. He described her as difficult to work for.
Rodgers was Epstein's pilot from 1991 to 2019, responsible for flying his private jet and maintaining flight logs.
Epstein sexually abused Giuffre repeatedly over several years during trips to multiple locations, often under the guise of 'massages.'
Maxwell groomed Giuffre, arranged her travel, gave her explicit instructions about pleasing Epstein, and made comments indicating awareness of the sexual abuse.
Maxwell met Farmer when she was 16, took her shopping, gave her a massage that exposed her breasts, and instructed her on how to massage Epstein's feet.
Epstein engaged in inappropriate touching (holding hand, rubbing arm) with Farmer during movies and got into her bed to 'cuddle.'
Maxwell introduced Virginia Giuffre to Michael Garland and made a comment about how long she had known Giuffre.

events.title: Initial meeting and grooming of Victim-1
events.description: Epstein and Maxwell met Victim-1 at a picnic table when she was 14. They later invited her to Epstein's Palm Beach house, began grooming her with gifts and attention, which led to sexual abuse.

events.title: First sexual abuse of Victim-1
events.description: Several months after meeting, Epstein sexually abused Victim-1 for the first time in the pool house at his Palm Beach residence while they were alone.

events.title: Group sexual encounters
events.description: Epstein frequently brought Victim-1 into his massage room for group sexual encounters with other women, often including Ghislaine Maxwell, who would guide and instruct the women.

events.title: Travel to New York and New Mexico
events.description: Beginning around age 14, Victim-1 traveled with Epstein and Maxwell to Epstein's New York mansion and his ranch in New Mexico, where abuse continued.

events.title: Juan Alessi's departure and theft
events.description: Juan Alessi and his wife left Epstein's employment in December 2002 with a $50,000 severance. Months later, Alessi broke into Epstein's house and stole cash, which he later repaid.

events.title: Search of Epstein's Florida residence
events.description: The Palm Beach Police Department executed a search warrant at Epstein's Florida residence, seizing evidence including framed photographs of Victim-1 as a teenager.

events.title: Conspiracy Period
events.description: The proposed conspiracy charges against Ghislaine Maxwell cover this period, alleging she conspired with Jeffrey Epstein to transport and entice minors for illegal sexual activity.

events.title: Palm Beach Rape and Schoolgirl Outfit Incident
events.description: Virginia Giuffre describes being forcibly raped by Epstein in Palm Beach after he gave her a schoolgirl outfit to wear. Epstein stated he had cheated on his 'arrangement' with Maxwell.

events.title: Trip to New Mexico Ranch
events.description: Annie Farmer, age 16, visits Epstein's New Mexico ranch. Maxwell grooms her, gives her a massage exposing her breasts, and Epstein gets into her bed to 'cuddle.'

events.title: Giuffre Emails Epstein in Prison
events.description: Virginia Giuffre writes supportive, loving emails to Jeffrey Epstein while he is in prison, which she later describes as part of a traumatic bond.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest and Victim Interviews
events.description: Following Jeffrey Epstein's 2019 arrest, victims including Virginia Giuffre and Jane speak with news outlets. Prosecutors interview Virginia Giuffre multiple times in 2019.

locations: New York City, New York (Epstein's mansion/townhouse)
keyFacts: The document is a prosecution memo seeking to charge Ghislaine Maxwell with conspiracy for transporting and enticing a minor (Victim-1) for illegal sexual activity on behalf of Jeffrey Epstein.
Victim-1 was 14 when she met Epstein and Maxwell, was groomed, and was sexually abused by Epstein for years, with Maxwell playing a key role in facilitating the abuse and normalizing it.
Flight logs from Epstein's pilot, David Rodgers, corroborate Victim-1's travel on Epstein's private jet with Epstein and Maxwell while she was a minor.
Witness Juan Alessi, Epstein's former house manager, corroborates Victim-1's presence at the Palm Beach house and details Maxwell's controlling role in household operations.
The document references interviews with other victims who describe Maxwell's role in recruiting and facilitating their encounters with Epstein.
Ghislaine Maxwell is proposed to be charged with two counts of conspiracy for transporting minors and enticing minors to travel for illegal sexual activity from 1994 to 1997.

Virginia Giuffre alleges Maxwell explicitly facilitated her abuse by Epstein, including providing a schoolgirl outfit, asking for details after 'massages,' and requesting she find other young-looking girls.
Annie Farmer alleges Maxwell gave her an inappropriate massage exposing her breasts and instructed her on how to massage Epstein's feet when Farmer was 16.
The document cites evidence that Maxwell knew victims were underage, including her comment to Michael Garland that she had known Virginia Giuffre since age 17.
Prosecutors note significant discovery challenges, including terabytes of unprocessed data from searches of Epstein's properties in July/August 2019.
